name: Chromefinch
description: The official store for Kasm supported workspaces.

workspaces.description: Chromium is a free and open-source browser, primarily developed and maintained by Google.
workspaces.name: kasmweb/chromium:develop

workspaces.description: REMnux is a Linux toolkit for reverse-engineering and analyzing malicious software.
workspaces.name: chromefinch/remnux:development
workspaces.notes:
A number of applications including VSCode and proxy browser within Burpsuite may require relaxed security in order to run correctly.

Adding: {"security_opt":["seccomp=unconfined"]} to the Docker Run Config Override (JSON) above may help these programs run with better compatibility.

workspaces.description: Ubuntu is a Linux distribution based on Debian.
workspaces.name: chromefinch/custom:5
workspaces.notes:
The Kasm Ubuntu Jammy Workspace requires libseccomp => 2.5.3 to run.

This can be checked by running runc --version

If you still want to run Ubuntu Jammy but do not have the minimum required libseccomp version, it can be run in an unsecure manner by adding: {"security_opt":["seccomp=unconfined"]} to the Docker Run Config Override (JSON) setting above.

NOTE: This will run the Workspace without the docker seccomp sandbox and will significantly reduce the amount of protection that Kasm Workspaces can provide.
